info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 23 at 2:15PM MST until February 24 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM FRIDAY TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, significant blowing and drifting snow expected with visibility reductions below one-half mile at times. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front and adjacent foothills and plains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until Noon MST Friday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 9 AM Friday to 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Widespread impacts from blowing and drifting snow are expected to begin as early as late Friday morning along the immediate Rocky Mountain Front, then extending out to the adjacent plains through the afternoon and early evening Friday and extending through Saturday afternoon. Expected impacts include road closures due to snow drifts blocking traffic and near-whiteout conditions at times.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
